comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: John Cardinal Murphy Farley (April 20, 1842 - September 17, 1918) was an Irish-American prelate, the seventh bishop (fourth archbishop) of the Roman Catholic diocese of New York. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Murphy_Farley Diomede Angelo Raffaele Gennaro Cardinal Falconio, OFM (September 20, 1842—February 8, 1917) was an Italian prelate of the Roman Catholic Church. He served as Prefect of the Congregation for Religious from 1916 until his death, and was elevated to the cardinalate in 1911. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diomede_Falconio FARLEY OFF; CHEERED BY 25,000 CATHOLICS; Great Demonstration on His Departure for Rome to Receive Appointment as Cardinal. By Wireless to The New York Times. November 15, 1911, Wednesday ON BOARD SS. KRONPRINZESSIN CECILIE, via Siasconsett, Mass., Nov. 14. -- Cardinals-Designate Farley and Falconio have been objects of affectionate and enthusiastic interest from their fellow-passengers ever since the ship passed out of the Narrows to-day. They are making the very best impression on everybody by their very kind manner. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163777412/]
